**Conversation Overview**

The user requested help transforming a solar training program document from Markdown format into a consolidated, bilingual HTML website with tabular layout for better at-a-glance viewing. They specifically wanted the content presented as sticky notes optimized for widescreen viewing, with Arabic as the primary language and an English toggle, while keeping "Learn/Apply/Sell" headers in English even in Arabic mode since they function as titles.

Claude initially created an overly complex design with rounded elements and busy styling that the user criticized as "incredibly ugly" with "too many rounded objects" that was "busy and hard to read." Claude then redesigned it as a cleaner sticky note board, but encountered a layout issue where the "Apply" column appeared as a "weird long green sidebar instead of a square."

The training program content focused on a 5-day solar energy installation course covering topics from basic safety and theory through practical construction, planning with PVWatts software, and final client presentations. Key elements included case studies of clients like Ahmed (coffee shop owner) and Zahra (textile workshop), hands-on equipment testing, business skills development, and progressive homework assignments. The user demonstrated familiarity with technical solar terminology, Arabic-English bilingual presentation needs, and specific pedagogical approaches for technical training delivery.
